member.name: T:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.FileTransfers
member.summary: Provides functionality for file transfers. Makes it possible to programmatically send and receive files using terminal.

member.name: M:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.FileTransfers.StartReceiver
member.summary: Initiates receiving of files using specified protocol. From that moment, all data received from the remote end are interpreted by the protocol, so they are not printed on the terminal.
member.returns: object, which can be used to receive files.

member.name: M:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.FileTransfers.StartSender
member.summary: Initiates sending of files using specified protocol. From that moment, all data received from the remote end are interpreted by the protocol, so they are not printed on the terminal.
member.returns: object, which can be used to send files.

member.name: E:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.FileTransfers.TransferProgressChanged
member.summary: Occurs when a transfer progress is changed.

member.name: P:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.FileTransfers.Terminal
member.summary: Gets the containing terminal object.

member.name: P:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.FileTransfers.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time in milliseconds before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is received from to server. This also means that data transfers only time out after x milliseconds of inactivity, not after x milliseconds from the start of the transfer.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.FileTransfers.EnableStreaming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the receiver initiates receiving in stream mode (effective for receiver only). Use this mode with caution. There is serious risk of buffer overrun on the serial port, that the protocol would not notice.
member.remarks: Enables YMODEM-G streaming for YMODEM.

member.name: P:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.FileTransfers.BlockSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a size of data block the sender uses when sending data (effective for sender only).

member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until an operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

member.name: M:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.TerminalOptions.SetColorIndex(Rebex.TerminalEmulation.SchemeColorName,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the palette index to be used by the specified named scheme color. This is only used for (see property).
member.remarks:
The default palette contains the following colors: 0 = Black, 1 = Red, 2 = Green, 3 = Yellow, 4 = Blue, 5 = Magenta, 6 = Cyan, 7 = LightGray, 8 = DarkGray, 9 = LightRed, 10 = LightGreen, 11 = LightYellow, 12 = LightBlue, 13 = LightMagenta, 14 = LightCyan, 15 = White, 16 and higher = Xterm colors.
When using TerminalControl object, call System.Windows.Forms.Control.Refresh method to apply the color changes immediately.

member.name: P:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.TerminalOptions.FunctionKeysMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior of function keys that include F1-F20, Insert, Delete, Home, End, Page Up and Page Down. The takes precedence for the behavior of Home and End keys unless set to HomeEndKeysMode.Standard.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a CR character is implied in any received LF.
member.value: True to imply CR in every LF; false to not imply.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to treat the incoming destructive backspace characters (7F) as non-destructive backspace (08).
member.value: True to treat destructive backspace as non-destructive, false to allow destructive backspace.

member.name: P:Rebex.TerminalEmulation.TerminalOptions.IgnoreSubstituteCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to ignore incoming substitute characters (1A) or replace them with replaced by a question mark.
member.value: True to ignore substitute characters; false to replace them with a question mark.

member.summary: Specifies whether escape sequence of the Select Graphic Rendition also clears the color of the pen.
member.value: True to persist last set color; false to reset color of the pen.
